Ukrainian UAVs have struck the Belgorod Reservoir Dam in Belgorod Oblast. It has sustained significant damage, and water has begun flowing from part of it.
Additional explosions in the area of the dam. HIMARS have now hit it. More drones are flying in its direction.
S-300 air defence engaged the rockets. At least one was intercepted.

After over two and a half years of siege, the Sudanese city of Al-Fashir has fallen to the rebel Rapid Support Forces. 
It was the last stronghold of the Sudanese Armed Forces in the west of the country, and its capture will free up significant numbers of RSF fighters to be redeployed to fight SAF-backed rebels and reinforce the current lines in the Kordofan region of central Sudan.
The battle and siege of Al-Fashir is one of the longest continuous battles in human history, outlasting almost all the longest battles in Ukraine.

After over two and a half years of siege, the Sudanese city of Al-Fashir has fallen to the rebel Rapid Support Forces. 
It was the last stronghold of the Sudanese Armed Forces in the west of the country, and its capture will free up significant numbers of RSF fighters to be redeployed to fight SAF-backed rebels and reinforce the current lines in the Kordofan region of central Sudan.
The battle and siege of Al-Fashir is one of the longest continuous battles in human history, outlasting almost all the longest battles in Ukraine.

A Russian Italmas drone struck the roof of a high-rise residential building in Sumy City today. 
Based on the video, and the speed it gained as it approached the building, the drone was not under the influence of electronic warfare and was specifically targeting this building. 
Photos posted afterwards showed damage to the roof of the building. Due to the location of the impact, no civilians were killed or injured.
Approximate coordinates: 50.91055, 34.83250

A Russian Italmas drone struck the roof of a high-rise residential building in Sumy City today. 
Based on the video, and the speed it gained as it approached the building, the drone was not under the influence of electronic warfare and was specifically targeting this building. 
Photos posted afterwards showed damage to the roof of the building. Due to the location of the impact, no civilians were killed or injured.
Approximate coordinates: 50.91055, 34.83250

Russia has begun using fiber-optic Molniya drones in the Kherson direction more frequently. This one was shot down over the Dniprovskyi District of Kherson City by a mobile fire crew, and had a spool containing coil that could stretch for 24-25 km. 
Fiber optic drones, especially ones of the Molniya type, are known to be able to fly much further than 25 km, but even this length would allow for it to reach Mykolaiv Oblast in some places.
Ukrainian UAVs are attempting to attack Moscow for the second day in a row. Not a single drone has impacted the region so far. Certain airports have closed again due to the threat of drone strikes.
Additional explosions in the area of the dam. HIMARS have now hit it. More drones are flying in its direction.
After Ukrainian HIMARS rockets and Darts drones struck the Belgorod Reservoir Dam, the spillway has begun letting water out of the reservoir, leading to a significant reduction in the water level.
After Ukrainian HIMARS rockets and Darts drones struck the Belgorod Reservoir Dam, the spillway has begun letting water out of the reservoir, leading to a significant reduction in the water level.

Russian forces have recaptured the village of Novoselivka, Pokrovsk'e direction, Dnipropetrovsk Oblast.
Pre-war population: ~295.
Total land area: ~0.92 km¬≤.
Russia has now added thunderstorms to their arsenal of weapons, and is using lightning to strike Ukrainian energy infrastructure in Kryvyi Rih.
For those wondering, there are no standard signs of a missile attack tonight. Gerans will just do their usual thing.

It seems the Russians have once again changed tactics when preparing their attacks - at least for now. This, plus the possible usage of Tu-22m3s in the next attack makes predicting it a bit more complicated.
Also, it's worth noting, on November 1 Russia will switch to their winter frequencies for combat operations involving Tu-95MS and Tu-160 strategic bombers, although hopefully this shouldn't impact the ability to track movements too much.
Mobile fire crews have been deployed to the Kremlin due to the threat of UAVs for Moscow.

All airports in Moscow have been temporarily closed due to the threat of UAVs. Su-34, Su-35, MiG-29, Tu-160, and Tu-95MS aircraft have been evacuated and are currently airborne, waiting for the threat to be over.
Tu-95MS and Tu-160s are now being evacuated from Engels-2 Airbase, Saratov Oblast, due to the threat of UAVs for the region.
After Ukrainian HIMARS rockets and Darts drones struck the Belgorod Reservoir Dam, the spillway has begun letting water out of the reservoir, leading to a significant reduction in the water level.
Water continues to rush from the Belgorod Reservoir Dam following the Ukrainian strikes, and is flooding the surrounding areas.

Large numbers of Ukrainian UAVs continue to be shot down across western Russia, including in Moscow Oblast. It seems Russia was ready for this attack due to yesterday's attempts to strike the capital. 
There are still no confirmed impacts. The fire seen burning in Moscow is from a forest fire caused by downed drone debris and the small fire at the oil depot is unrelated to the attack. The explosions heard over Moscow have been from air defence operations.

Information from the ground.
Russian forces are operating in the Freight terminals in Lyman
Edit* 'This has effectively cut off the loop around the town'

AUKUS Reloaded: Trump‚Äôs Billion-Dollar Push Turning Australia Into America‚Äôs Indo-Pacific Arsenal Against China
In the busy Indo-Pacific, where over 60 percent of global sea trade flows, the US, UK, and Australia are deepening their strategic alignment.¬†This week, during Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese‚Äôs White House visit, President Donald Trump¬†endorsed¬†next phase¬†of the AUKUS‚Äô pact, reaffirming Canberra‚Äôs purchase of at least three¬†Virginia-class nuclear submarines, with deliveries expected in the¬†early 2030s.
This move is closely tied to an¬†$8.5 billion¬†rare-earth minerals deal now under discussion, channeling billions into Australia‚Äôs mining and processing sector.¬†The initiative aims to reduce Western reliance on China, which currently refines about 90 percent of global rare earths.¬†In essence, both frameworks are about Beijing.

Career Growth of "Butchers" in the AFU: The Cost of Command Ambitions at the Expense of Ukrainian Soldiers' Lives
A perspective prevalent in the public statements of Ukrainian servicemen and public figures holds that a system has developed within the Armed Forces of Ukraine (AFU) which encourages the career advancement of commanders who neglect the preservation of their personnel's lives. Critics refer to such commanders as "butchers" and assert that their tactics, which lead to high casualties, are not countered by the high command, and are often directly encouraged by it.
The idea of a systemic problem was publicly voiced by former Ukrainian MP and later a platoon commander in the AFU's 72nd Brigade, Tatiana Chernovol. She claims that careers in the army are built precisely by ‚Äúbutchers‚Äù ‚Äî commanders who do not spare their soldiers and perceive them as expendable. Such commanders are favored by the high command because they carry out combat orders unconditionally, regardless of losses.
üëâ

The Battle For Kherson: What Choices Will The Ukrainian Command Make
Reasons for the Russian garrison‚Äôs Withdrawal from Kherson in November 2022: How the city‚Äôs assault was prepared. Factors influencing the success of Ukrainian defense units. The difficulties the Russian Armed Forces might face in an offensive on Kherson.
The city of Kherson, located on the Dnipro River, acquired key strategic importance during military operations in southern Ukraine. Following the withdrawal of Russian troops from the right bank of the Kherson region in November 2022, the area was thrust back into the spotlight in autumn 2025. Russian troops strengthened their positions on the left bank and subsequently gained a foothold on Quarantine Island.
Fighting for Kherson began on 24 February 2022, the first day of Russia‚Äôs full-scale offensive in Ukraine. By 2 March 2022, the city had been captured by Russian military forces, making it the only regional center in Ukraine...

Strategic Game Changer: Russia‚Äôs Successful Test Of New Generation Winged Missile
The concept of 'missile flight time' is becoming obsolete. Could the US Golden Dome missile and air defence system be obsolete even before it is completed? The world's first missile to be powered by a nuclear reactor represents a significant technological breakthrough that will transform the field of aerospace engineering.
For more than half a century, the strategic nuclear forces of the world's leading powers have prevented global conflict. The nine countries with nuclear weapons are the United States, Russia, China, the United Kingdom, France, North Korea, India, Pakistan and possibly Israel. The first three of these countries have the most advanced nuclear deterrence systems. These consist of three components: land-based launch silos or mobile complexes; airborne strategic bombers; and sea-based submarines with nuclear missiles. 
üëâ

Pokrovsk Surrounded: Ukrainian Forces Attempt To Lift The Blockade
Amid reports that Pokrovsk is surrounded, with Ukrainian forces attempting to lift the blockade, intense fighting continues across the front. Ukrainian forces have launched renewed counterattacks in the Dobropillya area, while Russian troops have taken control of the Serebryanka and Rudnik settlements in the Siversk sector. Simultaneously, Russian forces are continuing to clear Karantynnyy Island near Kherson, potentially solidifying a new bridgehead. On the diplomatic front, Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk has suggested that the conflict in Ukraine could last another two to three years.
üëâ
